title: 110_hr4750
content: The Act titled "Tax Relief and Fulfilling Our Obligation to Patriotic Soldiers Act of 2007" excludes enlistment and reenlistment bonuses for members of the Armed Forces from gross income. The Tax Relief and Fulfilling Our Obligation to Patriotic Soldiers Act of 2007 excludes qualified bonuses for members of the Armed Forces from gross income. A qualified bonus is defined as various types of bonuses paid by the Secretary concerned in exchange for the member's agreement. The Tax Relief and Fulfilling Our Obligation to Patriotic Soldiers Act of 2007 excludes qualified bonuses for members of the Armed Forces from gross income. The act defines qualified bonuses as bonuses paid by the Secretary concerned in exchange for the member's agreement to accept a commission, extend service commitment, enlist, reenlist, or enter into a reserve affiliation agreement. Amendments are made to section 2201 and the heading for section 112 of the Code. Amendments are made to section 112 of the Tax Relief and Fulfilling Our Obligation to Patriotic Soldiers Act of 2007, including inserting "and other" before "compensation" in various sections of the Code. Amendments to section 112 of the Tax Relief and Fulfilling Our Obligation to Patriotic Soldiers Act of 2007 include certain bonus payments to members of the Armed Forces retired or separated due to a combat-related injury. Effective date for amendments is after December 31, 2007. The Tax Relief and Fulfilling Our Obligation to Patriotic Soldiers Act of 2007 amended Chapter 17 of title 37 to ensure continued payment of bonuses to members retired or separated due to combat-related injuries. The Secretary of Defense is required to continue payment of entitled bonuses to such members under certain conditions. The Tax Relief and Fulfilling Our Obligation to Patriotic Soldiers Act of 2007 ensures continued payment of bonuses to members retired or separated due to combat-related injuries. Specific bonuses include special pay for aviation career officers, retention bonuses for medical and dental officers, accession bonuses for registered nurses, dental officers, pharmacy officers, and medical officers in critically short wartime specialties, as well as reenlistment bonuses for members of the Selected Reserve. The curr_chunk lists various types of bonuses available to military personnel, including reenlistment bonuses for the Selected Reserve, bonuses for affiliation or enlistment in the Selected Reserve, bonuses for elements of the Ready Reserve, prior service enlistment bonus, affiliation bonus for officers in the Selected Reserve, enlistment bonus, special pay for nuclear-qualified officers, nuclear career accession bonus, nuclear career annual incentive bonus, and engineering and scientific career continuation pay. The curr_chunk lists various types of bonuses available to military personnel, including career continuation pay for engineering and scientific fields, bonus for foreign language proficiency, special pay for officers in critical acquisition positions, special pay for special warfare officers, surface warfare officer continuation pay, judge advocate continuation pay, 15-year career status bonus, retention incentives for critical military skills, accession bonus for new officers in critical skills, and incentive bonus for conversion to military occupational specialty. The curr_chunk discusses various types of bonuses available to military personnel, including incentives for transfers between armed forces, retired members volunteering for high-demand assignments, and officer candidates. Bonuses must be paid in a lump sum within 30 days of retirement or separation. Combat-related injury is defined as an injury resulting in a Purple Heart award or as determined by the Secretary of Defense. The curr_chunk amends the conditions for combat-related injury benefits for military personnel, specifying that injuries must occur as a direct result of armed conflict, while engaged in hazardous service, in duty simulating war, or through an instrumentality of war. The curr_chunk amends conditions for combat-related injury benefits for military personnel by ensuring continued payment of bonuses to members retired or separated due to combat-related injuries.
